In case it was n't clear , wildfires are predominantly caused by accumulation of a sufficiently large amount of sufficiently dry combustible material .
Once it 's there , it will inevitably catch fire one day or another , arson or not .
And climate change has the potential to modulate that sufficiently dry attribute .

It is equally true that humanity is actively modulating the sufficiently large amount attribute ( for example by suppressing small undergrowth fires and by not cutting the undergrowth that would otherwise be removed by these fires ) , which does n't make things any better .
